newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - ANI in advanced talks over Holter.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - ANI in advanced talks over Holter.

text.p: Australian National Industries Ltd said on Monday it is in advanced discussions with various parties on the planned sale or joint venture of its wholly-owned German-based Holter environmental engineering business.

"We are currently very advanced in discussions with various parties concerning diposal or joint ventures with all of the various parts of Holter," managing director Peter Stancliffe told shareholders at the annual meeting.
"With Holter, I now believe we are fast approaching an acceptable structure and solution," Stancliffe said.

Last month, ANI announced that it had written off all of Holter's A$149.3 million goodwill and written down the values of plant and equipment by A$72.3 million and the value of joint ventures by A$12.0 million.

On October 1, ANI said it had extended the expiry date of an option agreement with government-owned Saarbergwerk AG of Germany for ANI to buy back 50 percent of the Saarberg-Holter Wassertechnik (SHW) waste water treatment business.
